doc.field: Letter to Angelica Schuyler Church (n.d.) [a machine-readable transcription]
Letter to Angelica Schuyler Church (n.d.) [a machine-readable transcription]
Print copy consulted: University of Virginia Special Collections, Angelica Schuyler Church Archive, accession number 11245
This letter has been grouped with the letters of Alexander Hamilton in the Church Archive at UVa Special Collections.
Print copy consulted: University of Virginia Special Collections, Angelica Schuyler Church Archive, accession number 11245
This letter has been grouped with the letters of Alexander Hamilton in the Church Archive at UVa Special Collections.

My very Dear beloved Angelica I have seated my self to write to you, but my heart is so sadend by your Absence that it can scarcly dictate, my Eyes so filled with tears that I shall not be able to write you much but Remember. Remember . my Dear sister of the Assurances of your returning to us, and do all you can to make your Absence short. tell M r . Church for me of the happiness he will give me, in bring- =ing you to me, not to me alone but to fond parents sisters friends and to my Hamilton who has for you all the affection of a fond own Brother. I can no more.
Adieu Adieu. heaven protect you E. H.
letter to angelica schuyler church n d a machine readable transcription
